body: Change has been reviewed and approved by Trina Krug. Thank you. I will merge once tests pass, unless there are other comments.
Is this change ready to be merged? I will do so in a few hours unless there there are new comments. The change in install_traf_components seems harmless (an extra blank line)
The changes look good to me.
Looks good to me. Is Trina on JIRA yet? Would be good if she can give her input directly.

Is the deprecated API getFamilyMap removed from some distro? It looks like we are creating more objects just to take care of the deprecated API. Won't it be good to use Cell concepts all the way to server instead of just to take care of this API alone on the client side.

Looks good to me. An interesting test case will be UPSERT on a column with a check constraint, for both the case where the row exists and where the row does not. Similarly for MERGE with both a WHEN MATCHED clause and a WHEN NOT MATCHED clause.
not yet Suresh.  I need to run tests before I can commit additional changes

This method is missing in some HBase 0.98.x version. It seems to be there in 0.98.1 and gone in 0.98.6, at least in the CDH versions.
See HBASE-10339. The method also seems to be gone in HBase 1 and 2, so we can hopefully replace it with the new method getFamilyCellMap().

if don't change this api , it will cause "initialize trafodion;" error

Changes look good to me. Thank you for doing this. I second Dave in asking for some testcases to be added to regressions. Maybe that can be done as part of JIRA 1610. If we do do decide to remove an attribute from nadefaults.cpp, that can be done later too. I will wait for a few hours and merge if there are no other comments.
Selva, do you have any objections to merging this change?

Change looks good. Please consider adding JIRA id to title of Pull request next time "[TRAFODION-1610]". That will cause this pull request information to be automatically placed in the JIRA for 1610, giving a record of the checkin. This seems to work on for the first JIRA in the title though.
Change looks good. Is this meant to be merged into 1.3 or the main branch?

It should be on 1.3, I will double check.

```
Roberta
```

@ryzuo could you please comment on Steve's suggestion? Even if it worked on our individual test environments, when a change does not work in Steve's official build environment we may not be able to merge it. You could get temporary access to the build machine from Steve and look there if that will help. Thank you for contributing this change and your patient responses to all questions.
Thanks Dave and Suresh. I will revisit the requested change when Hans is done with TRAFODION-1610
Changes look good. Do you want to revert the changes in .gitignore and Makefile ?
Looks good to me. Thank you for making these changes.
Thanks for the change - merging now.

maxKeyValueSize is not set. So the piece of code is not executed , looks like.  if there is plan to retain the code for later, I would change  "kv.getLength()" to "KeyValueUtil.length(cell)" where ever it is used. 

Rest of the code changes look good to me.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/109/
Are we ready to merge this change in?  I would recommend filling a JIRA to remove references to KeyValue and use Cell concepts in the trx-jar part of the code. This code is good to go in.
Selva, you should now have committer privileges. Would you like to test that out by committing this change?
Yes Dave. I will commit this change.
if you want to retain the error check, then it should go into core/bldenvchk.sh script that is run only during build time, not runtime.
Looks good to me. Putting it into bldenvchk.sh is good, but if the build fails, the error message should be fairly clear and easy to diagnose without a special check.

The check is already in bldenvchk, I just also erroneously added it to
sqenvcom.sh.

```
 Roberta
```

You're right, it is already in the bldenvchk.sh!  Looks good to me.
jenkins, retest -- infrastructure change was pre-mature for 1.3 release; jar file fix not back-ported to this branch.
Wonderful change! Reduces the opportunity for human error when we change versions.
Finally we  fixed it. Thanks.  Changes  look good to me.
Thanks Steve for this change - looks good
Can one of the committers verify this patch?
Can one of the committers verify this patch?
Please consider taking care of this issue in HbaseUpdate and yet another place where this flag is being set.
Requested Narendra Goyal and Prashanth Vasudev to review this change.
Looks good to me. I see mon.env and shell.env only in src/seabed/test  only in work station environment. May not be needed for normal working environment.

Thanks for this change. This will surely help in usage of T2 via multithreaded DCS.

While the review is in progress, could you also plan to implement some T2 specific unit test cases for this change ? Thank you.

I will be merging this change tomorrow because the files mon.env and shell.env are not generated by sqgen. But these files are sourced in by monitor and shell respectively in the code to set up its own properties.

Hi Arvind,

Actually the T2 Phoenix tests basically covered all we need for this (and this does not change any API of JDBC supplied for user). However, I have some tests for counting the performance of batch insert which I used it to compare it against the old driver and T4 driver. I can push it to somewhere in the repo.
Please do not merge until I have addressed the bug Hans found above.

Change looks good. It will improve performance with indexes. I am slightly concerned with how binder stage changes on resetting the serialization attribute of NAColumn in an index are not really used in the generator. Most likely I have missed something in the flow of logic.

See also TRAFODION-1522. To get rid of the warnings eventually, we can try to make a Maven project hierarchy and then change the version in the top-level pom.xml file. That would add one more place to update the version, but I hope that would be acceptable. Sorry, didn't get to work on this project hierarchy yet.

Thanks Suresh for your comments. The serialization concept is not supported for aligned format. There is no need to check if encoding is needed for the serialized column for aligned row format. Ideally, I could have encapsulated this concept in both the methods of IsEncodingNeededForSerialization, but chose to do it this way.
I've addressed the bug in the reworks. While testing this fix, it turns out a plan change somewhere surfaced another bug, in delete costing. I fixed that one as well.
Can one of the committers verify this patch?
Can one of the committers verify this patch?
jenkins, skip test -- docs do not affect the build
